key_risks: Regulatory and legal challenges across multiple jurisdictions
Agent retention issues due to competition
High valuation relative to earnings and cash flow
Sensitivity to macroeconomic factors like interest rates and real estate market cycles
controversies: Federal lawsuit in Miami alleging fraudulent practices, conspiracy, and negligence
Aggressive recruiting practices and loss of key agents to competitors
social_issues: Dependence on technology and potential market saturation
governance_issues: Compliance concerns with varying real estate regulations

sources.title: Even More Problems at eXp World Holdings (EXPI) - Substack
sources.snippet: eXp World Holdings (NASDAQ: EXPI — $1.65 billion) is the world's largest cloud-based real estate brokerage. The Bear Cave has published on problems at eXp twice before. In April 2022, The Bear Cave published on eXp's aggressive recruiting, regulatory troubles, and insider selling. And in May 2024, The Bear Cave published on how eXp's new competitors were stealing eXp's top agents.
